parameters.description: Limit number of alerts to return
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
List events for a node, newest first

---

Requires `alerts::read` permission.

Download configuration change audits

---

Requires `audits::read:config` permission.

parameters.description: ID for the item to audit. If specified, must include itemType.
parameters.name: itemID

parameters.description: Type of item to audit, e.g., Node or Cluster. If specified, must include itemID
parameters.name: itemType

parameters.description: Cursor returned from the previous request
parameters.name: timestamp

get.description:
List configuration change audits

---

Requires `audits::read:config` permission.

parameters.description: Cursor returned from the previous request
parameters.name: timestamp

ip.description: IP address of the client that initiated the change

itemId.description: Unique ID of the item that was changed

itemType.description: Type of the item that was changed

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when the change happened

userName.description: User name of the client that initiated the change

get.description:
List recent flow logs

---

Requires `audits::read:flows` permission.

parameters.description: Unix timestamp for the start of the log window
parameters.name: sTime

parameters.description: Unix timestamp for the end of the log window
parameters.name: eTime

parameters.description: Comparison operator for the end of the log window
parameters.name: eTimeOp

parameters.description: Comparison operator for the source port
parameters.name: srcPortOp

parameters.description: Comparison operator for the dest port
parameters.name: dstPortOp

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: When true, newer flow logs will be listed first
parameters.name: reverse

parameters.description: If provided, a flow must match at least one of the TCP flags provided. Decimal encoded, see flow log TCP flag encoding.
parameters.name: tcpFlags

x-cursor.description: Continuation cursor for the next query

tcpFlags.description:
TCP Flags encoded in hex:
* 0x01 - FIN
* 0x02 - SYN
* 0x04 - RST
* 0x08 - PSH
* 0x10 - ACK
* 0x20 - URG

parameters.description: Cursor returned from the previous request
parameters.name: timestamp

parameters.description: If specified, the nodes will return with their associated configuration.
parameters.name: withConfig

get.description: Get all orders. The responses for orders from this API request are not fully hydrated (eg, no nodes).

Flag an order

get.description:
Get all users

---

Note: changes to users sometimes take a few minutes to appear while being indexed

post.description:
Invite a user. For organizations using the default Trustgrid authentication provider, users must be **invited** and then they should sign up with the invited email address.
For custom IDP integrations, users should be **added** instead.

policyId.description: ID of the policy to be applied to the user upon account creation

post.description: Add a user. This is only available to organizations with custom IDP integrations.

idp.description: ID of the IDP to be used for the user

policyIds.description: IDs of the policy/policies to be applied to the user

maxRtt.description: Max round-trip time measured for this interval

meanRtt.description: Mean round-trip time measured for this interval

minRtt.description: Min round-trip time measured for this interval

numRtt.description: Number of RTTs measured for this interval

stdRtt.description: Standard deviation of RTTs measured for this interval

time.description: Unix timestamp, in milliseconds, of the start of the interval

channels.description: Channel IDs to broadcast alerts to

tags.description: Tags expressed as key=value to match

node.description: Node name that generated the alert

node_id.description: Node ID that generated the alert

nodeId.description: Node ID that generated the alert

nodeName.description: Node name that generated the alert

private_key.description: Private key for the certificate in PEM format

command.description: Command to run in the container

privileged.description: Run the container as a privileged user

requireConnectivity.description: Only start the container if the node has connectivity to the control plane. Needed for encrypted volumes.

stopTime.description: Grace period for container to stop when requested, in seconds

useInit.description: Indicates that an init process should be used as PID 1 in the container. Ensures responsibilities of an init system are performed inside the container (e.g., handling exit signals).

user.description: User name (or UID) and optionally the group (or GID) to use when starting the container.  This will override the USER specified in the image

retries.description: Number of health check retries before a container is marked unhealthy

startPeriod.description: Grace period before health checks are monitored, in seconds

files.description: Children, if a directory. This is a recursive model.

metaData.description: Metadata to be injected into the machine

userData.description: User data to be injected into the machine

location.description: Location of the image on the node

autoStart.description: Whether the machine should be started automatically after deploy

image.description: ID of the image for the machine

stopTimeout.description: Timeout in seconds for the machine to stop gracefully

interfaces.description: List of virtual interfaces for the VM

portMappings.description: Host ports to map to virtual machine ports

virtualNetworks.description: List of virtual networks to attach to the machine

volumes.description: List of volumes to attach to the machine

mem.description: Amount of memory for the machine

uid.description: Unique ID of the port mapping

KVMVirtualNetwork.description: Virtual network to attach to the VM

uid.description: Unique ID of the virtual network association

encrypted.description: Whether the volume should be encrypted

size.description: Size of the volume in bytes

KVMVolumeConfig.description: Volume to attach to the VM

online.description: True when the node is connected to the control plane

ha.description: True when this order is for an HA pair

interfacesCount.description: Number of interfaces to configure per node

nodeCount.description: Number of nodes needed to fulfill order

status.description: Order status. API-side holistic validations apply to orders whose status is in provisioning, qa, shipped, delivered, installed, and in production.

s3_access_key.description: S3 access key for log exports

s3_prefix.description: S3 key prefix for log exports

created_at.description: Unix timestamp when tag was created
